Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected, room for improvements!!”
Reviews.Author: Williamsca1975
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I thought our stay was going to be a disaster. However it wasn't that bad. The best thing about it was the location, right next to the train/metro station. The only thing that needs to improve is the occassional staff at reception, they need to improve on their customer service skills and learn to smile and be polite.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: sgsad
Reviews.Content: It has an excellent location. This hotel is one of the best choices for those willing to have excursions outside madrid. The hotel is almost above the train station, which save time and make it easy for anyone to catch the train to head for any excursion. Definitely It is the best pick for a tourist who wants to explore Madrid with its surroundings. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Husa Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Two improvements could be made: 1. The availability of a kettle in the room & 2. Ice machines on each floor

Reviews.Title: “It's ok if you can book it for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Janet_in_Portland
Reviews.Content: The best advantage is the train stop which is outsude the door and gets you downtown in two stops. There is nothing else in the area. The breakfast was so-so (the eggs were cold) although they did have quite a variety and the coffee is good. I think the beds are too hard, but I've had worse. There was plenty of hot water but the tub is really slippery and they have no tub mat. The indoor-outdoor carpet in the room is torn at the seam. The only chair to sit on is a kitchen dinette type of chair. The wi-fi is free but the system is ancient -- every device has to have a new password every day. On day one it was ok because they had a stack of passwords that you could just pick up but on day two we had to stand in line while the staff checked people in. When one person asked nicely if the stack of passwords was available the clerk gruffly told her to get back in line. When we finally got to the counter 10+ minutes later all the clerk did was pull out the stack of pre-printed passwords!! He was busy and grumpy, but really? The other staff person who got me extra pillows was very nice and helpful, though. We are on the 9th floor and can hear some street musician trumpeter at 10:50 at night. It will probably be hard to sleep if Spain wins the soccer game that the whole country appears to be watching. The rooms are very spacious. I usually stay at smaller, old hotels with character near the center of town but am on an all-inclusive student trip with my daughter. I expected the hotels to be worse and was pleasantly surprised by this and the one in Barcelona. If this is available at a big discount then I would consider staying here for the train convenience if staying in the center of town is not important to you. But don't expect the four stars they claim for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad! Retro cool”
Reviews.Author: Alenmecan
Reviews.Content: After the scary reviews I have read here, I was very nervous about staying at this hotel. But, I actually quite enjoyed it in the end, and it was an interesting 3 night stay. The hotel building is very ugly from the outside and it is the worst of the 70ties architecture. This hotel was (partially) renovated, but they have kept many REALLY retro things - I found it great fun to see a crank to wind the window blinds, or a shoeshine machine on every floor, just like in my childhood. The blow dryer in the bathroom was an amazing huge contraption, and there was a "control panel" next to the bed with large dials for two preset radio stations :) However, the rooms are very spatious and clean, as is the bathroom which does have outdated installations. The breakfast was surprisingly good on all days- many warm dishes, cereals, cold cuts and cheeses, fruit juices and fresh (and some awful canned) fruit. There was a group of school children staying on my floor one night, but the staff did their best to reign them in. I was staying there during the week, so I do not know about the noise from the disco club many were complaining about. Internet access is free, but you have to enter the new code every 24 hours (so pick up sufficient vouchers when checking in). I felt safe in the area, and have used the metro and the train stations, but the area itself does look like a dystopia that was hit by a meteorite recently. I would definitely stay again if I had business in the area, for leasure I think I would rather be in a different part of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Donboro
Reviews.Content: After few nights in Spain, on my final night I picked this hotel, whish is close to train station, where I have arrived. First of all the staff was kinda unfriendly and looked not very dedicated in customer service. The hotel is rather huge and you feel like you are in some kind of dormitory. The room -small, you cannot see anything from the window as it was too dirty. Btahroom looked like thirty years ago, with everything very worn out and unpleasently looking. Breakfast was nothing special and the best thing was that I have to stay only one night. Obviously one word is summarizing this hotel - Depressing...

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: FabioCastro
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with some decades, is not old, but you can't expect a modern style hotel. Most of the areas are renovated, elevators are new, or room had really new floor, and it was ok for everything. I speak well spanish so I can't tell if their english was ok. If you catch some promotion, or not find a better place, go for this, is not that bad as some peole told, at least for me.

Reviews.Title: “OK , not as bad as some would have you beleive!”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, it's very convenient for the railway station [about 50m]. Looking at some of the reviews here I thought I must have been in another hotel! It's sold as a 4star hotel and by and large it fulfils the requirements. The rooms are large and quiet, security seems very good, everything worked in the room as it should. There were some cigarette burns on the carpet but you'd only see them on your hands n knees but what you get up to in your room's your own affair! I didn't eat there so can't comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible....”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This must the the worst described hotel ever.... Its sold as a modern 4 star hotel, I booked it myself through lastminute.com... At a very affordable price of 60 euro/night, I thought I found a bargain. That impression lasted until the moment i stepped into the room... I might have been modern one day, but i believe that was in the end of the 80´s or possibly in the beginning of the 90´s, which was the last time it was renovated... I would like to point out that im a fairy seasoned traveller with more than 1000 nights in hotels worldwide, and yes, i have have stayed in worst places than this, however that was in the 90´s when i was bagpacking in Asia... The room was good sized, but the decoration was as outdated as I have ever seen, a mixture of peeling repainted wood furniture and, and horrible taste. The television reminded me of what i used to have in my bedroom in my youth, only the basic Spanish channels. The beds was OK, however the smallest pillows i have ever seen I tried to call the reception to see if there was possible to get a few extra, but was told that this service was not available, ended up folding the two available ones double and got through the night that way... If you as myself like shacking up in bed with your laptop working, forget it assuming you dont carry two batteries, since there was only one place to connect the cable, -On the opposite side of the room. Bathroom can probably best be described as beige, and have most likely missed the last renovation in the 90´s... A warning would also be for everyone to flush the pipes for at least a couple of minutes before you step into the shower, since the water coming out initially was absolutely brown, i was assured by the receptionist that this was an isolated case, however a quick survey conducted at breakfast concluded that this "isolated case" happened on at least 3 more floors, and according to a cleaner it has gone on for years... This was not a case of just some corrusion coming out initially, it went on for a long time... For those of you needing decent WIFI I would recommend McDonald´s 10 min walk away, since it was really weak and kept cutting. Basically, for an additional 5-10 euros there are plenty of other 4 star hotels within walking distance, without having seen them more than from the outside, I would recommend anyone to beware of this place and search for another....

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rickyk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean tidy and well appointed with all required elements simple to get on train as station. Beneath hotel access to town centre and sol very easy and reasonable prices too Rooms dated felt like I'd gone back to the 70's but clean and serviceable Free wifi all areas friendly staff good enough for a buis trip if I were going with family I may consider it too Pleasant stay thank you

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pruth
Reviews.Content: This hotel has spent all its refurbishing money on the lobby. The hallway carpets are separated at all of the seams. That was the first warning sign as we walked to our room. The metal parts in the shower were rusted. The carpets were dirty and worn. The room, though very spacious, was old and worn. This was a scary place. We were afraid to touch anything or sit on the beds. We booked a room for 2 nights and left before the first night, even though they refused to refund us for the first night. We ended up in a real 4 star hotel paying less money per night. Though we ate the Husa first night charge we were much more relaxed and very comfortable in our clean, upgraded hotel at Plaza Castilla. The advantage to Husa Chamartin is supposed to be because it is situated on top of the metro/train station. However, the metro system is very efficient and one can stay in other hotels at Plaza Castilla with easily accessible metro and be across town in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Train, that's it”
Reviews.Author: HpyCampr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October and the location is great for commuting into the city. It's a tourist hotel, period. The food is barely edible and the wifi is very weak and almost unusable.

Reviews.Title: “OLD”
Reviews.Author: jpm2085
Reviews.Content: i know madrid quite well and took a chance on this one as i had to go to the british consulate in Torre Espacio which was close by,,,,to be honest, if you get it for 50 euros per night as we did for 4 nights then might be worth it, but its really old and is by no stretch if the imagination a 4 star. Its above the station, but to be honest its best to be located close to Atocha than Chamartin and there's nothing in this area worth seeing. the hotel was clean but really really old. Noisey at night time from young gangs hanging around in the waste ground around the train station...would recommend looking for a good 2 star in the Atocha / chueca / plaza santa ana / calle serrano areas, these are the best areas of Madrid...avoid this one unless really cheap! Just as well Madrid was brilliant as usual!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for everybody.”
Reviews.Author: distance10
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is not a 4 star one anymore, but it was maybe 20 years ago. On the other hand for 50 Euros per night for a double room you get a spacious room well equipped with air-condition, safe, hairdryer, minibar, free Wi-Fi, a very beautiful spacious bathroom, and most important, you are next to the railway station, which brings you wherever you would like to. The hotel staff was friendly, although not everybody speaks English, and the rooms are relatively clean. In the area by the hotel, you will find a couple of restaurants and cafes, but for further options, I would advise you to visit the city center either by metro or by taxi (you will find a lot directly outside of the building). As Conclusion, it is a nice hotel, and if you are travelling on a budget, and want to avoid the city center, but with a room with great size and comfortable beds you are here right. About the breakfast, I cannot tell you anything about, because it was extremely overpriced, but you are going to find enough cafes and restaurants in the railway station next to the Husa Chamartin. I would recommend this hotel to everybody, through it is perfectly located near the Bernabeu Stadium and also good situated to the public transports for a City trip.

Reviews.Title: “good to take the train”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: good if you have to take the train, is 1 minute walking to the chamartin station from chamartin can go in cercanias to downtown in 12 minutes to the airport in 16 minutes maybe the hotel is old, but normal, good, always better to stay in gran via, but chamartin is a better option than barajas , closer to the city if you have much luggage, better move in taxi or stay close to barajas

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: kjambro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is used because it sits on top of the train station. Had I any idea how easy it was to get around the city of Madrid by train, I would have kept going to a much nicer area of the city. I asked for a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room. There was construction going on so you were woken up each morning by jackhammers. There was a hatch in the ceiling of the bathroom that slammed every time you opened or closed the bathroom door or the door to the room. There is absolutely NO SOUND PROOFING what so ever. You hear your neighbors do everything from coughing up phlem in the morning to having sex. The beds were uncomfortable and the pillows were flat and hard as boards. The only good thing about it was the access to the train.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel at all..”
Reviews.Author: Nounoush T
Reviews.Content: Very poor breakfast with rude and unfriendly waitresses. we asked for simple tea, the waitress pointed at a direction saying go and get it!! Hotel amneties are old. location is next to train station which is the only positive point in case you travel by train elsewhere. Overall we never chose HUSA chains again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, no hot water”
Reviews.Author: Ben H
Reviews.Content: No hot water, super tiny bathroom. If you're used to a small American shower this will still be too small : )

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Husa Chamartin 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: erolbenezra
Reviews.Content: It was the first visit to Madrid and we wanted nice confortable and cheap hotel.I found it and it was really very nice hotel.The train and metro station is just under the hotel.Nice shopping places.Delicious restaurant especially one china restaurant was very very cheap with very nice food.The breakfast was great the staff was helpfull.Nice wiev from the rooms.The room which we stayed was quite big.Very near to every where.If you go to Madrid I advice to stay in this nice hotel. erol benezra

Reviews.Title: “First class accomodation in a first class location”
Reviews.Author: KDSAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious and comfortable - to the point of being luxurious. The hotel is right at the Chamartin railway station which was very convenient. I thought the location may have been noisy, but there was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you are going with train from chamartin”
Reviews.Author: Pineda
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff ,big rooms and very cheap! Nice restaurants some steps down to the city. Very practical place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “My hotel destination in Madrid: Husa Chamartin”
Reviews.Author: matrixamp
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location. U have metro, taxi, bus, parking for your car. Train station with it's stores and foodstores in a 50mts radius from the hotel door. Very kind people attending us. Free internet all day long. Only changes password every 24 hours. Nice breakfast with plenty of variety of candy such as croissants, bread, and fruits, and tomato for my "tostada" :). I had a magnificent wiew to the 4 towers. Didn't put on the tv. Could ear the cars outside but that didn't took my sleep. Is not a very recent furniture or a hotel by that matters but it's pleasent. What can i say: like it very much would be back for sure next time to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: msb444
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel. Although they gave us a suite and the room was huge, the hotel is old and not well maintained. The rug was stained, the bathroom tiles were discolored, the television was old and had very few channel selections, there were very few bathroom amenities. It was obvious that they didn't vacuum the room regularly. My husband and I are highly allergic to dust mites. A few minutes in the room and we both kept sneezing and had to take our medications. It also smells like cigarettes. It is located near the train station which is probably it's only advantage. However, if your a tourist who wants to walk around the city and see the sights, it is very far. It will cost you 20 euro one way to get to the city. The breakfast was okay but if you want to go elsewhere for lunch or dinner, there isn't much around the area. For what you will pay for this hotel, it is better to stay in a modern hostal in the city.

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanuja27
Reviews.Content: did not like my stay here. it claims to be afour star but it is only a two star probably. the lobby is shabby and needs renovation. the restaurant is small and very basic. the rooms are also so so. would never come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Baz15
Reviews.Content: I would love to say what it was like to stay at this hotel, but I can't, because they stuffed up my booking. We arrived at the hotel to find that they were fully booked and we had no room, despite the fact that they had already charged my credit card and I had sent them an email a few weeks earlier confirming my booking and arrival. As for the setting, it was depressing. Dark brown bricks and tiles and the approaches to the hotel were through broken bottles and waste paper as well as a couple of gangs of youths. Very dodgy. Foyer was polished but dark and depressing with the dining area looking as if it was straight out of th 1960's. There was a group of American students who told us we were lucky to have an escape as they were very unhappy with the hotel, but that is their story and I will leave it to them to tell it. I know we didn't get to stay, so I can't comment on the rooms, but the atmosphere was not very good. Still waiting for a refund, but I will get that one way or another.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located where we had to drop off our rental car and very close to the airport where we had to go the day after. In the middle of a dark, shady and suspicious zone in the outskirts of Madrid, this one was one of our longest nights during our visit to Spain. I am usually good at following Tripadvisor ratings, but this was such an affordable one-night I thought it wouldn't but help our budget. Truly, how bad could it be? The hotel is attached to the train and metro stations. Going in, you feel that no one has done a single thing to the building since the 70's. After, you realize that it is not a feeling, it is a fact. The indifferent and cold staff at reception will also make you believe that the last time any customer service standard was followed in this establishment was several decades ago. When it is your turn to be helped they don't ask, they just stare. Don't be surprised either at how forceful they are to receive full payment in advance. I'm sure they must have many guests who'd like to run away before paying. Once at the room, the bathroom light flickers for a minute before it turns on. More authentic than a motel in a horror movie - the bathroom has no toiletries but a shampoo dispenser worthy of a gas station. The rooms are so dated they carry a strange smell. So old that beside the bed you can still find the switches for elevator music and one-switch-AC. You can even find those switches used to call room service, I honestly wouldn't believe to see that again. The TV, we must admit was a bit more modern, perhaps the 80's? It should come with an attached VCR. The beds sheets wil remind you of those used in the ER and full of strange dark spots. The beds are also hard as a rock. On the adjacent room, a group of teenagers (part of a rugby team) were celebrating until late at night. I don't want to elaborate on the awful job the receptionists and security staff were at handling the matter, but at some point we were told if we called the police it would be extremely convenient for them as they were too busy to handle the matter. We had just a few hours of "sleep" just to realize a few days after that we were guilty for ignoring the reviews and taking a chance solely on the location and price. If you happen to be sucked in for the same reason, remember you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business, but there are better central hotels for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Lizlon
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about this hotel after reading the reviews on here... but had no choice as it was booked by my office. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived and was booked into a suite instead of just a room (as my colleague was). It was very nice to have space to spread out to work, I had a lovely living/dining area with a balcony, a separate bedroom, and bathroom. It was clean, there were sweets lying around the room every time it was cleaned... fresh towels etc. The wifi was good, but you do (as someone else said) have to get a new code from the recpetion every day - which was a little annoying when I got in a 1:30 AM after working for 12 hours and just wanted to check my email - then had to go downstairs to get the password! Breakfast was ok, the eggs were cold but the tortilla was fantastic, as were the pastries and toast. Can't say as much for the coffee or tea, but it's Spain! I could hear the bathrooms from the other rooms around me - so when my neighbour got up at 6AM and got in the shower, I woke up... then again for each room near mine - pretty annoying when I only finished work at 2 AM. All in all, it was ok. Would I stay there again? If I had to for work, but not for pleasure, I'd rather be close to the action...

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for the railway station and the airport”
Reviews.Author: Ropongi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over the Chamartin railway station, where most of the northern trains depart, with quick connections to the city centre by suburban railway (Cercanias). It is just 15 minutes by taxi from Barajas airport. The decoration is out of date and requires a complete refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Comfort and Convenience in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Margaret33388
Reviews.Content: Convenient to Metro and Train near Madrid's second largest train station. All the amenities of a modern hotel and a great escape from the second hand smoke that permeates Madrid. Great business and tourist hotel for the money. Excellent location so you are minutes from any attraction or business location in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Too old, need a renovation, but great location for the fair”
Reviews.Author: dragos_ro
Reviews.Content: I've stay here during FITUR 2011 and I had chosen this hotel because his location close to the Fair and the free shuttle from hotel provided by the organisors. The location was perfect for what I wanted because the distance from hotel to the fair was done in max 15 minutes with the shittle. By metro I had to change one time but it was also very quick. The metro station and the rail station (Chamartin) is in front of hotel. To the center is direct line (10 stops) to Puerta del Sol or Gran Via. The rooms are looking old but quite spaciouss. Internet is free of charge. The breakfast is ok. If you get the hotel at a good rate, and you are looking for a 3-4 star hotel with good connection to the center , Husa Chamartin can be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Terrible Bed”
Reviews.Author: hkmny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located--Chamartin station is right down stairs--lines to the metro and Cercanias. There are several restaurants inside the train station--Burger King, Pans, diner type restaurant, etc. The front desk staff is ok--they won't go out of their way to help you, but they are relatively friendly. The room was average with good working wifi. The bed was the worst bed I've ever slept in, and usually I'm not picky about beds. This was basically like sleeping on concrete, After a couple of nights, my hip was killing me, and I should be about 4 decades away from having hip problems. Even though it's conveniently located near/at the train station, I wouldn't consider staying here again due to the terrible bed.

Reviews.Title: “Essentials missing, but at least a decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: digitalje
Reviews.Content: The negatives: 1. Plan to bring your own iron. There are none available in the rooms and the laundry service takes about 1.5 days to press anything. 2. If you crave coffee or want to heat up some water, you'll be out of luck. You will need to venture outside to the train station to get a cup or order up some room service. 3. The bed was like sleeping on a rock. 4. Showering consisted of a daily fight with the shower curtain. The tub is so narrow that any move you made ended up with the shower curtain clinging to your body. 5. Forget about calling the reception desk for anything. They never answer the phone. Plan on making a trip down to the front desk if you need anything, like the DAILY access code for the Wi-Fi connection. If the hotel knows how many nights I will be there for, do I really need to make the daily pilgrimage? 6. If you plan on having any private conversations, don't plan on doing it in your hotel room. The walls are paper-thin. The positives: 1. Breakfast was great. There was a wide variety of food that was very tasty. 2. The location to the metro is great. The metro station is right under the hotel so jumping on the train was very easy. 3. Althought the bed was a rock, the sheets were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: CHARLESRioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: If you want to know Madrid by metro, the husa chamartin is the perfect hotel to stay, because it is inside the chamartin station. there is not atractions near the hotel but, in 10 minutes you get in the plaza Cibeles, downtown of Madrid, where everthing happens. The hotel is comfortable. If it is possible, avoid the breakfast at de hotel ... the rates are lower without it.

Reviews.Title: “No Smiles at 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pyon-pyon-usagi
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the hotel due to the location. I came back to Madrid from Santiago by train, and needed to go to the airport the next day. The location was ok in that point, though there is nothing interesting within waking distance. What I was disappointed at, even offended with, was the attitude of the reception staff. They just said "Hola" to anyone WITHOUT looking at the clients. They could even say that to a statue or a dog. And they just demanded our document and without smile or any nice word, told us the number of the room. I needed some information about the way to go to the airport and some other things ,but he reluctantly answered, very blunt. Also I asked another where the lift was. She pointed at the sign very impolitely, as if she thought I was illiterate or something. I've had much nicer hospitality even in a pentione, or a no star hotel. The room was ok, but the first impression at the reception damaged my feelings and could't enjoy my stay. People come before facilities, I think. They need to train the staff if they want a true reputaion as a true 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “30 sec from Chamartin station, Good”
Reviews.Author: Moon_Yuni
Reviews.Content: It's really nice hotel. It's stick to Chamartin station. just 30 sec. There is fast train go to Center for 10 min. It's very conviniet subway and train. Luxury Hotel. Free luggage service. Breakfast is really fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Avoid, Avoid”
Reviews.Author: semigoodlookin
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent traveller since I was 16. I have satyed in hostels, 2 star, 3 star, 4 star, and 5. In the last few years I only stay in 4 stars. In all my travels to various hotels of varying quality, this is without doubt the most sub standard, and honestly, awful. I am not even the type to write these kinds of reviews, but I feel strongly about how bad this place was. I will start with what is the only good point, but this has a massive downfall too; that is location. Without question in terms of accessability to Madrid in its entirety this hotel scores marks; how can it not when it is literally on top of one of Madrids biggest transport hubs. However the area around Chamartin station is shocking, delapedated, old, and left me feeling uneasy about my partners safety, it is like Kabul, and that is not being unkind. The hotle itself boasts fairly large rooms, but why do they totally reek of smoke; I know I am not the first to mention this. I do not think it is because people are smoking (Which they are) but I think it is because the smell of smoke has imbedded itself onto the decor and such. That is how old this place is, the electronic equipment is laughable; there was something in my bathroom that I was at a loss to identify, but my wife assured me it was a hairdryer? There was a car window handle to operate the window blinds, that is hilarious in a 4 star hotel. The general cleanliness cannot be critisised because it was fairly spotless, no stains or things like that. I had a really bad chest and cough in this place due to the smokey stench (I am not usually too affected by these things). This whole place really needs to be renovated ASAP. It was the most dissapointing hotel stay I have encountered, the reason being if you stay in a 2 star for example you expect and accept little gripes you may have; but in a 4 star? You at least expect to be comfortable and satisfied. One more personal problem, please put power point near the bed!! I have read some reply from the hotel to bad reviews and these are typical managment speech which is as impersonal as the actual staff there. Just a scripted apology I think.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the senventies!!Rude staff included!!”
Reviews.Author: procopeo
Reviews.Content: After a month staying in cheap guesthouses in Southeast Asia I wanted to take a rest in a four star hotel located in te train station. What a terrible mistake !! A 10 dollar rooms in a Laos guesthouse is more worth than this " 4 star hotel ". This hotel shouldn´t have been inspected since the seventies. It is unbearable that this establishement boasts a 4 star rating. Robot-style receptionists just saying Passport, not greeting us, but demanding unpolitely our documents. I was so tired after a long haul flight that we didin´t even bother to get angry. We just wanted our room and a good night´s sleep. The room, and the hotel itself , needs a complete and deep renovation. The seventies design has long gone out of fashion. It was funny to rediscovered things and electrical devices I saw as a child in my grandma´s home. Lots of memories from my childhood arises at the contemplation of this kitsh room. But the best of our stay was the cleaning services. Cleaners knocking to your door at seven in the morning, waking you up, just to check if she could clean the room. I was shocked when I notice that it was te cleaner demanding me to clean the room at seven in the morning. Waken up at seven o´clock by the cleaner asking if she can clean the room of a 4 star hotel!! Crazy but true !!! We just have a shower and left. We didn´t even report it to the robots downstairs. We just wanted to get out and get finally back to our city after this last stop.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome sight for a foreigner”
Reviews.Author: Forgottensage
Reviews.Content: Coming off of the train from Barcelona, it was the first hotel that I spotted. It is right in the train station & the last thing I wanted to do was go tackle a city I didn't know on foot, looking for a hotel. The hotel itself is plain, multi-leveled, and its rooms are non-descript, though a pretty decent size. The staff was indifferent and did not acknowledge me one way or the other beyond a look. It would have been nice to have been at least greeted or made to feel welcome, but it seems that this is the the Spanish way, as I noticed this trend in other hotels in Spain as well. Spaniards, perhaps, feel a strong need to protect a traveler's privacy boundaries. My sense is that if you need that personal warmth, you will probably have to go the five star route. But just having a decent hotel room and ready access to the train station, accompanying mall area, and an easy ability to begin to get an on-foot orientation to the beautiful city of Madrid overcame my hurt pride about feeling "invisible". Madrid's subway and bus system is very easy to figure out. I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly I learned to get around and find the incredible Retiro Park, the Prado & other museums, etc. Once I did, I moved to a very attractive location but this first hotel made me feel safe and helped me get my bearings, so I will give it four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Might have been a good hotel in the 40s, looks like a time warp when you walk in.”
Reviews.Author: la_canchita
Reviews.Content: I agree that this hotel is no where near a 4*. Do they even have any idea what a 4* hotel is like? According to any hotel rating system this place falls at least to a 2.5* for me. The rooms were a tacky 40s or 50s style with these old box which was used to put on the air conditioning, call for room service, turn on the light, etc. The box looked from those old movies when electric devices first came out. It had these massive buttons and turn pegs, very strange indeed, but not anything close to what anyone would consider to be a 4*. The air conditioning also couldn't be controlled beyond 1 and 2, so that we couldn't actually choose to the temperature, and that made it extremely uncomfortable. 2 selections for air conditioning is pretty poor. I Think. The other hotel in Spain I stayed at that was a 3* had each room with a private temperature control, and other 'luxuries' that Husa just didnt live up to. To begin with, they didn't even provide the normal essentials that I normally would get in a 2.5* hotel. No bar soap to wash my hands, no shampoo or conditioner, etc. The pillows were as thin as my arm (say max 2-3 inches) and as hard as a rock. The curtains didnt even cover the whole window, so you had to choose between having the middle covered or the outsides. The place was quite dusty and I was afraid to put my things down until I'd done a wipe down first. Also, though they are a non-smoking hotel, our room stuck horribly of smoke and there was an ashtray in the room!! When I asked about this I was told that people still end up smoking in the rooms even though it is not allowed, and they provide the ashtray so that these people will not ash on to the floor. There is apparently some kind of censor in the vent that alerts the front desk that someone in that room is smoking, and they call them and tell them to put out the cigarette. Not sure how well this system works since our room stunk, but nonetheless the hotel is meant to be non-smoking. All I can say is that my asthma and allergies were horrible there at night and I can only attribute this to the smoking in the rooms. I booked through a well known online website where you cannot see the actual name of the hotel you are purchasing until after the purchase is make, thus giving a better price. The website seemed to imply that the hotel was in they city centre zone, or 'El Centro-Old Madrid' as they called. it, I guess it was in Old Madrid alright, old as in the 40s, as the hotel looked as well. I was expecting an actual European city centre where you are at the actual architectural spots of the city, but alas I was fooled. So, the location is extremely far. Took about 30-40 minutes on the metro, not really what we were looking for. The metro station is not the nicest, but i guess it works. It is pretty dodgy at night so beware. (a side note, if you purchase the tourist metro ticket for Zone A you can take the "renfe" train which is much faster as it only stops in one other location before arriving at the Sol stop, the real city centre. This way takes only 15 minutes, so I definitely suggest this route). Anyhow, if you know which online website I am referring to, beware that 'El-Centro" for Madrid could be anywhere in Madrid, expect perhaps the suburbs. Breakfast, if not included is a pricey 13 euros, so don't waste your money and head to the city center where there are loads of great places, one being La Catedral, just a few blocks from the Sol metro. Also, internet is 2euros for 15 minutes! you can get one hour in a cafe for 1 euro... It is also so noisy! Sounds like you are sleeping on the side of a major highway/motorway with massive trucks flying by, honking their horns, etc... The windows didn't have any sound proofing at all, so that also kept us up at night. I would think one thing a 4* hotel that happens to be in a loud location could do is have windows that keep that noise out. Hope someone finds this helpful. There are plenty of nicer places to stay, with more helpful staff and staff that will help you find what you are looking for, not forcing you to use their things so they can make money (example: we were trying to make a call with our mobile and went to ask the front desk how to call out, (i.e. what the calling codes were) and they said it would only work if you called from our room, which of course would be a charge to us!!) so don't waste your money, you will get better service at a less * place.

Reviews.Title: “Blech”
Reviews.Author: TheCanuckTraveller
Reviews.Content: It is located right inside the train station - which is why we chose this hotel. We were travelling by train and wanted to be close by. The price was right- and this place is supposed to be a 4* hotel- yeah right- this was not 4*. I was travelling with a friend and we had backpacks. The employees did not treat us the same as the 'businessmen' who were in front of us. We were 2 young females with backpacks instead of briefcases. They were not friendly at all- and when we asked for a non-smoking room they sent us to a room that stunk! There was an ashtray in the room- and when we went downstairs to change the room they said all rooms were nonsmoking! (then why an ashtray?????) The positive thing about this place was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Old style, but nice location (for a train station...)”
Reviews.Author: Eng_Pepi
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is located "inside" the Chamartin train station... The hotel is old (15 years??) and needs some improvements (take of those carpets!!) but the rooms are OK and clean, the bathroom has space and nice soaps&champoos... Personnel is not so nice (old fashioned), regular breakfast. General review: OK for a stay if you need to be inside the train station... 90EUR/night...

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Carole0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. The price of drinks at the bar were very reasonable. The hotel is a bit far out from the city centre but dont let that put you off because it is on the railway station and metro station. But not at all noisy. I had the best nights sleep that i had anywhere in the world. When you arrive at madrid airport you can arrive at this hotel via metro system very easily. I advise anybody to buy a metro ticket (1day, 3day,7day). The metro system is very efficent and runs 24 hours. Madrid is a city that should be put on the must visit list of every1.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gringo472
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in September 2007 for three nights, it was extremely easy to find this hotel, in fact it would be hard not to see it when you leave the Charmartin train station as it is literally across the road. The reception was very spacious and clean and welcoming, the staff spoke good enough English and we had no problems getting our room. Just across from the reception is the room where you get breakfast in the morning, again a large well lit room with a very big selection of food ranging from fruit, cereal, bread, cold meat, cakes and hot sausage, eggs and bacon and the usual drinks you would expect to see at breakfast, all there for you to help yourself, an excellent start to the day. Next to the breakfast room is a bar, in the evenings when we were there they had a guy playing the piano, it was a nice setting, although I got the impression they would have preferred you to dress up a little to use it, as I had a funny look when I walked in wearing jeans and a rugby shirt, I should point out that just outside the second level enterance by the reception desk there is a nice little bar, serving beer and I found it more comfortable to relax in, as it had the feel of a real British pub, also complimentary bar snacks when you order a few beers. Onto the room itself, we had ours on the seventh floor, all floors are serviced by four elevators which were clean and worked well. The room was of a reasonable size, had air con, TV, mini bar fridge and the ever important safe. The beds were comfortable, although only one pillow each, and no spares in the wardrobe, I'm sure they would have sent more if we had asked for them, but we didn't. They had blinds outside the room, operated by a small handle under the window, and these really made a difference, the room was very dark when the blinds were closed, perfect for sleeping, the noise level from outside was also at a minimum with good soundproofed windows. The bathroom was nice, with a toilet, bidet and a shower over the bath, plenty of hot water for showering. When we checked out we were able to use the hotel's luggage storeroom to keep our bags until we needed to collect them later in the day. The hotel is well situated for the traveller and tourist, although it takes two Metro trains to reach it from Madrid Airport, but that's only a minor problem when you consider there is virtually no walking required since the hotel is right outside the station, I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, but.”
Reviews.Author: Lilis_Skyremix
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a night train from Barcelona, so I was pretty tired. It was 7:30, and I knew I wouldn´t be allowed to check in. So I got myself a cup of coffee and waited an hour. The location of this hotel was amazing. I was at Chamartin Station, and the hotel was just next to it!! I didn´t have to drag my sorry luggage to who-knows-where. I went in, told front desk I just came from a night train, thankfully they gave my room right away. Yay. I had a single room for the night, and room was ok. Bedroom was very clean, but the bathroom wasn´t what I expected from a 4-star hotel. There was this big window in the bedroom and a drape outside the window. I turn a nob and, voila! bright sunlight comes in to my room. Services. I had a couple of laundry to do so I called the front desk and tell them to send a maid up. A lady knocks my door and askes for my stuff. 2 hours later, she knocks on my door again with cleaned, and ironed clothes. So, it was quite good. One complaint though. I carry around two rechargers for my PDA and my cell phone. I looked around the bed for a plug, but couldn´t find one. There was only one plug openly available, and that one was in the bathroom. I had to go behind the TV to find an empty socket. Other than that, it was a nice hotel. But I do hope they´d speak a better English next time I come.

Reviews.Title: “descent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyriaki
Reviews.Content: My husband , my son and me and a couple of friends stayed at the Husa Chamartin hotel on February attending the Madrid Feria.The hotel was convenient for the exhibiton and the center of Madrid , though in Madrid you always have to go through Nuevos Ministerios station.I chose this hotel because it had triple rooms , it was close to the Feria and the price was fair enough .Rooms and bathrooms are very spacious and breakfast is very rich .There is a nice lobby where there is a piano . The bar , also is nice .I did not like the noise coming from other rooms , where students on vacation stayed .

Reviews.Title: “a depressing hotel in a depressing area”
Reviews.Author: fbob454
Reviews.Content: Overall a very sad, grey, tired place. Surely not even a 3-star hotel. I guess it needed being refurbished not now, but 10 or 20 years ago. They should not charge more than 70 euros per room. The carpets are dirty and the bathrooms are so old that they cannot possibly have a clean appearance no matter how often they're cleaned. The hotel lacks the modern facilities you would expect from a 3 or 4 star hotel. There is no room service and we feared the station's public parking was rather unsafe (the hotel does not have it's own). Employees were kind, but I feared they are short of staff. I was in a business trip and chose that particular location. Still, there are much better hotels nearby (Silken Castilla is a great choice, I strongly recommend it). In case the reader wants to know, Chamartin station is a pretty very bad location for tourism. It is far away from almost everything you want to do or see in Madrid. I may not be staying at a Husa hotel again, if I can avoid it. it is just unacceptable they have not invested a single cent in improving or redecorating the hotel and still charge 120 euros per room. I found it insulting. Overall, a depressing hotel not worth its price, located in a very sad area

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired”
Reviews.Author: jimbob22
Reviews.Content: Cheap and handy but four star ? 3 at a push, rooms ok, and handy for trains and underground. Probably four star twenty years ago but needs some work now. Really warm in rooms even in Winter. No car park.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Tourist Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: imsma
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in this hotel with a group of eight women visiting the museums in Madrid. The hotel is approximately 20 minutes by taxi from the airport and next door to a train station. It would be convenient for business travellers en route to and from Madrid and other locations in Spain, but as a tourist hotel it is VERY INCONVENIENT. It takes approximately 40 minutes to get to the center of Madrid on the Metro. The hotel offers a full buffet breakfast for 12 euros, but it is nearly impossible to just get a cup of coffee. The only option for eating is the train station, which has a few quick, but not very good restaurants. It's not easy to find a good meal within a reasonable distance from the hotel. The rooms are clean, but very noisy on the weekends, if you choose to sleep with the windows open, because of a nearby disco. Most of the staff responded quickly to minor problems-such as not being able to open the room safe-and were generally efficient, if not especially friendly. Overall, Hotel Chamartin is okay, but I would not recommend it as a tourist hotel or for more than one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Overnight train”
Reviews.Author: lilnation
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Husa Chamartin for 4 days in May. I had to take the overnight train to Lisbon which left at 22:45 , so it was perfect for me. The rooms were very clean and larger than most other hotel rooms. The staff was helpful and friendly. Trips to City Centre was approximately 15-20 minutes by Metro. The hotel would be suitable for family vacationers b/c it is situated on a huge complex. Most of facilities were closed when I was there but I believe around June, July and August they should be open. There is a bowling alley, a disco, and other facilities for a vacationing family.

Reviews.Title: “Husa Chamartin was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing really fancy, but excellent service and clean, comfortable rooms. The desk staff was very helpful, giving advice for traveling around all of Spain and suggesting places to go. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: bennettfamily
Reviews.Content: went to spain, xmas day to new years day. booked on the 16 of dec. using expedia, hotel and airfare. r/t from atlanta, six nites room and breakfast. $2000 for two of us. madrid is great. hotel called husa chamartin. excellent for the price with breakfast. over a train station. no noise. on the metro, the best subway system ever. took the ave {bullet train} to seville . 345 miles on the train . takes 2 1/2 hours. the greatest. go tourist 104 dollars round trip. Seville is most beautiful and exciting. stayed at the gran hotel renacimiento. beautiful, but out of the way. i would stay downtown in the old part of town. no food recs, to us food is just fuel, and we just ate the local specials. we just walked and looked and enjoyed. nice people, but very little english spoken. museums spectacular. lovely country
